website_summaries.verdict: A decently priced 12.5' aluminum telescoping ladder that gets high marks for its safety features and ease of use.
pros: Constructed from a premium aluminum alloy
Built-in plastic pillars between the steps protect your fingers
cons: Ladder can be a little wobbly when fully extended
Some found that the steps or buttons broke easily or arrive broken

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is awesome so far for the money. I’m 6’2” 230 and it handled my weight just fine. Easy to extend and close. Glad I bought one, other extension ladders are a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Black Dog

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! Wonderful product! I needed a tall ladder for yard work and selected this one. It is lightweight, yet solid. Easily pops-up to full size and exactly what I needed. This is a great product and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder For RVing
customer_reviews.text: This Aluminum Telescopic Extension Ladder has been a big help when I have work to do on my RV like washing the roof and other minor repairs. The extendable telescoping ladder with spring loaded locking mechanism non-slip ribbing. Takes up very little room under the RV when stored.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: ... this in our 5th wheel trailer and it stores nicely in the lower compartment bay
customer_reviews.text: Using this in our 5th wheel trailer and it stores nicely in the lower compartment bay. Very good build quality and sturdy. A must for anyone that travels in a trailer and needs to access slide-outs or hard to reach areas. Can't beat the price or quality.
customer_reviews.author: Denver

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how well and easy this ladder works
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how well and easy this ladder works ! It has some bend to it when fully extended but feels safe and sturdy . Packs and travels great and it has saved the day on several of my jobs ... great price, great value and it arrived quickly and in perfect condition . 100% satisfied with this ladder. Great buy !!
customer_reviews.author: Brian evancho

customer_reviews.title: Father approved
customer_reviews.text: My father liked it so much he told me that I should buy one for myself and took mine ! 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: This is such a smart space saving set of stairs
customer_reviews.text: This is such a smart space saving set of stairs. I’d highly recommend. Great for almost any job. Fully extended maybe not as stable as a fixed length ladder but fine for what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Kingham

customer_reviews.title: this ladder is great, we bought it for our trailer and it ...
customer_reviews.text: this ladder is great, we bought it for our trailer and it works great. we have had many people ask about it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor ventures made easier
customer_reviews.text: Use this ladder when traveling with my Hobie Kayaks. Truck is lifted and hard to lock and tie down yak without some help. Ladder is tall enough to work on roof of travel trailer then can collapse to the right height for truck. Made very well and easy and safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Needed a lightweight ladder to access tight spaces and this thing works great. So much easier than using standard ladders and ...
customer_reviews.text: This ladder arrived on time and works exactly as advertised. Needed a lightweight ladder to access tight spaces and this thing works great. So much easier than using standard ladders and MUCH lighter than 'folding' ladders.
customer_reviews.author: kfireuser

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: At first it was the perfect ladder, but the lock pina broke in less than three uses.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product, do not buy!! Bought this ladder and it broke the first time in use, I fell and hurt my arm (thankfully no major bleeding or broken bones) but this is a very poorly made ladder! Unsafe product, do NOT recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Taft

customer_reviews.title: Ladder purchase satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs...Find it easy to use and built with quality..Sturdy for my weight 190 lbs. Very satisfied...Price was fair..
customer_reviews.author: jaf

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY -BROKE first use! HAZARDOUS!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this is a piece of crap. Broke the FIRST time we tried to open the rungs of the ladder - we did not even get to actually use it! The mechanism on each rung to hold them open is completely cheap plastic on each rung - which could cause the whole ladder to collapse and someone to fall. I guess we are thankful no one died or was seriously injured using this junk! BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Laura A.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not contractor grade but good enough for most homeowner uses
customer_reviews.text: Got this to be able to access my attic, works perfectly for that. Wouldn't use it to get on the roof or into my skylight wells without someone holding as it is a bit flexible and I want a spotter. Definitely not contractor grade but good enough for most homeowner uses
customer_reviews.author: CalGal

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase !!! A Pleasure to use !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised. This was the perfect solution to making more room in my garage. I wanted to get rid of my bulky extension ladder and yet still have a sturdy ladder to handle my various needs. This ladder is good quality and I also Am impressed how well the safety mechanism works as to not pinch your hands. When closing ladder it does not DROP but instead closes slowly. Also, another big seller for me was that I can adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic material
customer_reviews.text: I received my ladder and opened box to see a broken plastic clamp that supports the first step It looks like it was damaged during shipping, these support s should be made of aluminum or a stronger material, this break can be caused by simple dropping the ladder on its legs. At least the first step to be stronger because that the step that get impacted
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gianopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and handy.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy. I bought to carry along in the RV and this has been perfect for that application as well as around the house.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for folding ladder, as extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: This ladder replaced a 20-year-old folding aluminum ladder. This is much more compact and easier to extend. However, I will still get to use my old one, when I need to use a step ladder, not extension ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: hey it is a unique ladder for my purpose for ...
customer_reviews.text: hey it is a unique ladder for my purpose for getting on my shed roof to inspect and have handy for climbing to reach certain items I use on a daily basis
customer_reviews.author: fred wojtuniak

customer_reviews.title: I loved this ladder until it broke and that was after having it only a couple short months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this ladder. Then it broke just a couple months after having it. I'll attach a picture of where it cracked. I'm not sure if this is common or if I just got a bad one but at this point I can't recommend this ladder to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Traviscf

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was not even able to use the ladder. When I first opened up the packaging the product appeared to be made of sturdy material. I opened up the ladder all the way and then when I attempted to collapse the ladder it would not fully collapse to the bottom (stays locked open). I’m fairly dissapointed and would not recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda VanAmburg

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, but a little wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder, but a little wobbly. I always hold it when my boyfriend climbs up on i for safety purposes..
customer_reviews.author: lolajack

customer_reviews.title: Works great I really like it i can store it any ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great I really like it i can store it any where, i can even carry it inside my Honda Accord not that heavy and super long fully extended!
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous to fingers when collapsing!
customer_reviews.text: In spite of all the warnings on the package and such, it is very easy to accidentally get your fingers pinched when lowering or adjusting the telescoping ladder. Very painful, I can testify. This thing would never be allowed at Home Depot because of the lawsuit liability. -- R Carlson MD
customer_reviews.author: R Carlson MD

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good product but mine arrived broken it two places.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety and durability are most important, and this ladder is neither both.
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time I used it. The first step completely broke off as I took the first step up the ladder. Thank God it was the first step instead of the steps higher up. I would send it back, but I disposed of all the packaging. Never will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A Brown

customer_reviews.title: A solid value in telescopic ladders.
customer_reviews.text: A good value in telescopic ladders. Unfortunately, it was missing one of the stoppers between steps upon arrival. It doesn't appear to hurt functionality, but also doesn't look as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Can it hold a big guy like me? Yes, it can.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescopic ladder. I don't own a truck to carry around a large extension ladder. My first thought when I purchased this is, how well will it hold a guy with extra pounds like me? Surprisingly, it is the ladder I use most. It allows me to make house calls. Whether I am asked to look at a friend, neighbor or In-laws roof. What I was pleasantly surprised at is the individual adjustment clips to correct overextending the ladder without having to collapse the whole thing and start all over. Really love this ladder and a very good price for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cool concept - UNSAFE PLASTIC COMPONENTS BROKE AFTER 2 USES!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design concept for storage and easy deployment, however, the second time i used it both the bottom and the third steps BROKE upon retracting them - unfortunately i did not notice until opening it a third time and saw my ladder was diagonal and not aligned. Then i saw the cheap plastic was cracked on both steps. Cmon! The bottom steps are literally the most important pieces of this whole unit! Without them safely working, the entire thing is nothing but a top-heavy safety-hazard! BTW i only weigh 160 and again, I've only used this TWICE!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Lippincott

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spend the money and get one that is more heavy duty. I ordered this one because it is light weight and more affordable. The clips have failed on me three times so far (YES I am extremely careful that they are all full engaged and green). I do not feel secure climbing on it and I am 150lbs. I was going to return it but you get 30 days from order, not delivery and my last day was literally YESTERDAY. Money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: lb77

customer_reviews.title: well made, sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: I bought for class a rv. It extends in seconds, is sturdy, and is the perfect length past the roof to be relatively safe going up and coming down. Obviously the main selling point is that it telescopes down to about 36" and is easy to stow in the rv storage areas. There is a pinch risk when you are lowering the ladder, as all rungs above the one you release will also release and come sliding down on your fingers, so just keep them clear and be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome ladder. I live in a loft with very ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome ladder. I live in a loft with very high ceilings and minimal storage space. This ladder works perfectly for my situation, is sturdy & safe.
customer_reviews.author: SALLY A TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: good little ladder
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome little ladder. It works well and is easy to use. Lightweight and doesn't make me nervous to use.
customer_reviews.author: Buying.all.the.things.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a product that would allow me access to the top of my travel trailer. This ladder meets all those needs. Easy to set up and store.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Made in China cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews but didn't learn my lesson. The ladder arrived broken. Cheap plastic and made in china. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, versatile and durable, higly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had got this a long time ago. It is ridiculously easy to use and very durable. It is better than a stepladder in many applications and supports my 275 lbs weight very well . Highly recommend..
customer_reviews.author: FeelinGreat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to raise.  Wobbly at the top though
customer_reviews.text: Used for routine household maintenance. Used mostly for those just-can't-reach areas for my 12' stepladder. I like it. its easy to erect, easy to collapse down. You can't collapse partway down. you have to lower it all the way, they re-expaned it to the desired hight. When fully (or mostly ) extended, it feels very "mushy" and insecure. Basically it feels "bendey". Don't recommend for very large people (over US 180). 200 # US might be able to use it fully extended, but they won't like it. Their heart will be racing and they'll feel like they could tip over at any moment. Someone holding the bottom is critical, but doesn't help much with the experience above.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D Bonney

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I stepped on the lower rung one side slid out of position and dropped by 30 degrees. I am well within the weight limit. Needless to say I returned it. I had a photo of it but since this review is a few months after the purchase it has since been deleted.
customer_reviews.author: cd3001

customer_reviews.title: Decent but be careful!
customer_reviews.text: Overall was pretty satisfied for what it was until last week when I went to use it and one of the lower steps/lock parts completely cracked apart as I was climbing it. Fortunately I was only 3 steps up and didn’t fall to the ground. However that was enough for me to promptly throw it in the dumpster. It didn’t even make it 2 years since purchase. It was not used very much as it was kept in my motorhome in the basement storage. It stores away quite nicely and worked well and people asked me about it pretty often. I just can’t recommend it anymore after its failure.
customer_reviews.author: glynns

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awful
customer_reviews.text: Although this is an interesting design, it is too flimsy to be used every day. The one button retract is a nice idea, but after a month of use, the slightest amount of dirt will cause this ladder to jam. I tried to un-jam it and it came apart with some little plastic pieces breaking off the ladder body. In addition, this design causes you to extend the latter from the bottom instead of the top. So if you want to reach some area half the ladder height, the bulk of the ladder will be on top instead of the bottom. Simply awful!!
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this ladder but after only 2-3 uses, one of the steps on the ladder will not lock in place. It sinks down a bit which is disturbing and I’m scared to use it now. Thought it was going to be great but not so much. **Update - the seller proactively reached out to me because of the experience I had with the ladder. It's certainly possible I got a defective ladder so I'll update my review once I've used the new one. I'm increasing my rating to 2 star just based on the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: HSBEA

customer_reviews.title: Not safe, you will fall
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase. You can die using this. Fall, hit your head and die of an acute intracranial hemorrhage. I have three people try this ladder for house chores. These are individuals who work regularly on home improvement projects. All three ended up bringing their own to complete project and advised me to throw this ladder away.
customer_reviews.author: LIna Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my camping trailer
customer_reviews.text: It fits in the under storage area of my trailer, is light enough to just leave in there all the time, and is a great alternative to getting a ladder installed on the trailer itself. I can get on top of the trailer, sure. But I can also use it to tie guy lines in trees, or for various things around the house. It is very easy to use and quite sturdy, and easily fits in the trunk of my car if I need to take it somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder! Fast deployment!
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far, but works so well. Read the instructions carefully so you don't pinch your fingers. You can retract the entire ladder by just pushing two levers and let gravity do the work. The ladder collapses at a nice rate, just keep your fingers clear. Also this is less than half of the weight of my other aluminum ladder. That one folds and had more versatility but is a killer on the back to lift and move. This ladder is so light in comparison. Still 25 lbs or so, but it can easily be carried in one hand and will fit in any vehicle, and takes up no storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: For being skeptical at first, It works!!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend & I recently bought our first home. We needed a ladder which he was very interested in getting a telescope. I looked around & Decided to purchase this one. We took it out of the box & Were able to set it up & Put it to use! No assembly required, I would recommend reading the manual & The neat safety checklist it provides. However, My boyfriend loves it! Couldn't stop raving about it. Very happy with my purchase! Would recommend to anyone interested in getting a neat, compact, portable ladder. 👍
customer_reviews.author: zachary piragnoli

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!! Snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is light but flimsy. I could never trust that it locked from day 1. Indeed I had a terrible accident yesterday. After I stepped on the 3rd step, one of the locks fails and the ladder snapped in half. I fell completely on the ground, and the top half of the ladder fell on the head of the person holding the ladder. I have had a couple of ladders before this and never had any ladder broke. Veey dangerous. Simply unacceptable!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Qin

customer_reviews.title: I understand the high reviews
customer_reviews.text: We had blown the ceiling hallway light (it lasted 6 yrs)-hence the pics, the space we have is very tight! So my review is based on the ladder being fully extended and the rather tight fit on the hallway steps itself or my footing on the steps. It was very easy to extend all the way and to release for storage. When moving while fully extended it did feel a tad wobbly. The storage itself is excellent~
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M

customer_reviews.title: Almost there
customer_reviews.text: So far not so good... first time testing it out, bottom rung is loose on one side. After closer inspection, its missing a critical piece. After checking the 1 star reviews, seems like this is a fairly regular occurrence. They need to figure out their manufacturing process, especially when producing equipment that can severely insure people (luckily mine was the bottom rung, so I was only a foot from the ground when it slipped). Update: -Company did offer free replacement -Replacement arrived, but I have yet to use it (already completed task)
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: One of the buttons required to operate the thing fell off within six months!
customer_reviews.author: L. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: not too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: not too good to be true! this folds neatly intro the back of my Honda Pilot, and that is with a ton of catering items already there. at an event, I simply amaze and pop it out, click to the desired height, then lean against the wall and climb. I'm a hefty gal, I weigh up towards the 175 mark, and have never had an issue, in fact I have carried 50 pounds with me as I ascended this beast of ingenuity.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri L. Haynes

customer_reviews.title: broke 2nd time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Rv...just in case. The second time I pulled out to use one of the rungs would not extend..some things fell out and it is worthless. I am just grateful it did not fail while I was on it. I have to have one so I'm trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Walden

customer_reviews.title: Slippery, Not Enough Traction
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is great for its storage size but very scary to use. It’s very slippery from a oil coating of some sort and it doesn’t have proper traction on the bottom. It doesn’t have the flexibility of a fiberglass ladder so it’s easy for it to slide of the point of contact at it’s top. It’s good quality material but I doubt I’ll use it for any work at height’s over 8’
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic step holders  break
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of infrequent use, the bottom two steps simple broke at the (plastic) mounts...while I was climbing them. Poor quality plastic castings, I think. Review Update: After my comments - and on their own motivation - the company sent me a new, heavier, stronger unit. Many thanks to a company that pays attention and tries to make things right. Clearly, they have redesigned the ladder and it is now a bit beefier (I'd guess it weighs about 6 pounds more that the original one) and seems to have better quality plastic catches and a better strap assembly than the first. It worked fine for me today, and I hope it continues to do so.
customer_reviews.author: John Ratzkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: VERY slippery from the factory
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is COVERED in grease / lubricant from the factory . My hands were COVERED in grease after the first use . And I was slipping off the ladder . I used dish soap and degreaser to try to remove it from my hands and couldn’t ...... I don’t think this ladder is safe at all
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: The Ladder for Most of Us
customer_reviews.text: A handy device which goes where no step ladder or extension ladder will go. It takes up about the same space as a foldable 2-step stool, expands easily, retracts quickly, and is quite sturdy. It's not easy to drag an extension ladder through the house to reach a high ceiling or shelf, but this guy is a cinch. You can extend it partially if needed. My only harp is that the steps are narrow and not angled like most ladders for level foot-placement. This is a good option for quick jobs, repeated relocations, tight spots and easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is not user friendly. It is oddly heavy for what it is. It takes a great deal of strength to open it in the way the instructions require. Closing it as instructed takes a lot of thumb strength while holding it in an awkward position. If you don’t follow the instructions, you will be injured or even lose a finger. I did try to use it and found that The small circular feet slip easily on all but the roughest surfaces....it’s ok on chip sealed asphalt but not much of any other place. I wish I could return it....
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer1

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store, carry, and open. Closing was easy enough; I placed the ladder on the ground and worked from the top down to keep from pinching my fingers (i.e. I didn't allow gravity to slam the steps shut). I'm light (120lbs) so the ladder worked really well for me, and it was stable enough on grass to feel safe enough to use alone. The top 3 steps are not for standing on so the height you need should factor this in. I was able to use it to get on top of my RV with no problem, and am happy that it stores easily to take with me if needed.
customer_reviews.author: thenauticalnun

customer_reviews.title: Handy ladder
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ladder because I wanted something that was lightweight, portable, and easy to store. You should read the instructions for raising the ladder first so you understand how it works. It is pretty lightweight and easy to handle. I would not want to carry it a long distance though. It collapses into something you can move around and is easy to find a place to store. I have used it to clean the gutters on a one-story house. It feels sturdy. I weigh 220 and I felt safe.
customer_reviews.author: Goree E. Waugh

customer_reviews.title: Seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this ladder today to keep in my camper. I have been waiting to do some maintenance that I can't be reach with my 4 foot ladder. It's seems really sturdy but I wish it was lighter because were Living in our camper and weight is important. I hope it serves me well for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Bressler

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this purchase. Easy to use and has worked quite well for letting me work on (and get on) my RV. The only complaint, really, is that you extend the ladder from the bottom which means that if you want to extend the ladder all the way you will need to lay it down on the ground and then stand it up when fully extended. Kind of a hassle but it's light enough that it's certainly doable. I do wonder if someday it will collapse on me but that's just my insecurities. It certainly seems solid enough.
customer_reviews.author: jayvan

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, just watch your fingers when closing, very cheap locking/unlocking mechanism
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder. Much more stable and secure than my "Professional" extension ladders for the house, we ordered this for our RV as a way to access the slide upper surfaces and regions of the trailer we couldn't get to from a stepladder. The ingenious retraction mechanism ensures no mashed fingers and a controllable collapse from full extension. Did I mention I love this ladder?
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design if you want options for multiple length
customer_reviews.text: I hate this ladder. It makes no sense. Either you can extend it to its maximum length- or an an intermediate length. The max you can go for intermediate length is basically as tall as you can reach. Because of the way it extends, you really can’t do anything in between maximum and your max reach. I can’t explain it very well. But in the Q and A you will see the answer to this question changes around one year ago. It’s honestly just annoying because I can’t imagine why anyone would design a ladder like this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sunderji

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: From the very first of having this ladder it was hard to operate. It would take two people to open it up pulling on both ends. Then to close it the smaller rungs would retract fine then the last 3 would have to be forced down. Just recently the last rung would bottom out half way closed. Then just today another rung 2 up from the last james up. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: RamFuzion

customer_reviews.title: It’s small but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep in my rv, it is very portable and sturdy. I was a bit skeptical about this ladder but after using it several times I can say I am pleased to have bought it. It easily extends and collapses just as easy. Just make sure to lock the sections into place, I extended it once and had one rung that didn’t lock and got a surprise when climbing it. It didn’t collapse but it did start to close on the one side.
customer_reviews.author: James N

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, I honestly expected it to be wobblier and flimsier. I was pleasantly surprised at how solid it feels. I'm 220lbs and I had no problem using it to hang a heavy painting in an awkward staircase location. The fact that it collapses into such a compact size means that it's easy to keep in the house - in a closet, or wherever - without having to drag it in-and-out of a garage/shed/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Davis

customer_reviews.title: Handy ladder
customer_reviews.text: I iike the fact that it is a space saver and collapsible. It is a versatile ladder but for more of a outside use, not a step ladder. It does feel a bit cheap made but I didn’t have any issues and I weigh about 220. It is just a tad short fully extended of being able to get on the roof of a one story home. I believe it’s made in China but ships from US. It’s not the highest reaching best ladder on the market but it works well for my needs so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: does not grip
customer_reviews.text: very disappointing in the fact that this extension ladder does not grip AT ALL on hard floors. the ladder literally slid down the wall on me as I was trying to install my air filter. I had to move a bathroom carpet that gripped under the ladder so i didn't fall and hurt myself. Would not recommend unless you have carpeted flooring or someone to hold you up!
customer_reviews.author: Trina R. Loskot

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months
customer_reviews.text: After having this product 4 months, I can not even open the ladder. It tells you in the directions to keep dust off ladder... Its a ladder.....Now ladder will not open all the way.. It just gets stuck and no matter how hard you pull on it , it will not open. What now???
customer_reviews.author: Susan Miss

customer_reviews.title: Takes some practice to learn how to use it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this ladder to access our attic. Our hatch is in our small Master bedroom walk-in closet. A-frame ladders are extremely awkward to move around in that space so this seemed like a good option. I am a 115 lb woman and I find it difficult to extend the ladder by myself. I find it does flex a bit when climbing even at my weight. It works very well for the intended purpose and retracts and stores easily. I would recommend it for light use where other types of ladders may not fit easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon girl

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not the highest quality of this type of ladder, but it's quite good, works nice and smoothly, and feels nice and study when climbing. We use it indoors for light duty primarily, so we're not exactly stressing it. Have to watch out when collapsing the ladder back down, but it doesn't seem especially dangerous. It brakes as it gets near the final position.
customer_reviews.author: George Marinich

customer_reviews.title: Light, sturdy, easy, perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this ladder yesterday afternoon. Used it this morning to touch up some gutter work. Wow, what a great ladder. Exactly as represented. Light enough for my 72yr. old arms to set up and move around easily. Sturdy and stable enough for the 72 yr. old legs to feel safe on. Easy to extend, and even easier to collapse and store. We got it mainly to do maintenance on our 5th wheel, and I already know it will be perfect. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Former Fan

customer_reviews.title: Compact, adjustable, sturdy for basic jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very compact, not too heavy, easy to adjust to needed height. Ok price. Cons: could do damage to fingers if not careful compressing it, gives a lot in the middle so probably shouldn’t be used on slight degrees or as any sort of bridge support. I’ve used this to pressure wash higher parts of our house’s siding as well as to access our roof. I like it’s conscripts size and ability to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Quinley

customer_reviews.title: Super portable but not very stable base or top so you have to be more intentional with placement
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this thing is a lifesaver as far as portability is concerned. Pros - The easy collapse mechanism is amazing - Very solid when extended and easily handles my 170lbs - So lightweight and portable when collapsed Cons - Base feet aren't very stable as compared to all my other ladders whose feet either pivot or are stickier rubber - Top is "slippery" as it doesn't have lobes to anchor itself against tree trunks and such
customer_reviews.author: P Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: Found out about this product while watching an old rerun of "Tool Time. Thought it wasn't true but there it was online for sale. Used it to reach a high window over the front door. Worked great & no more hauling in the tall ladder from outside. The only thing is that you need to watch how you bring it back down ,& not pinch you finger plus make note that both side have to line up to fold down. Stores right in the garage where we use to put a small kitchen step ladder. Great product. Must watch the reruns of Tim Allen more often. Will order one for both of our sons & their family this Christmas. .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is THE best. I'm a 71 year old woman. I easily brought the ladder up my spiral staircase, extended it, hung pictures on my 10' walls, collapsed it, and put it in the closet. Its legs are wide at the bottom with really good grips, so it's very stable. Makes me glad I accidentally ran over the foot of my old aluminum one! I can't recommend it highly enough. (And no, I'm not a Russian bot--just an enthusiastic purchaser.)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Logos

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, doesn’t last, no reply
customer_reviews.text: 4 months is all it lasted and absolute crickets from seller upon inquiry, not a single word! Zero stars all around. My Telesteps lasted 12 years but was out of stock for replacement—too popular I guess—should’ve known better! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder to access an attic.  Works well and no pinched fingers.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Have used it to access my attic several times in the past month. It is well made. You need to keep it clean so that the extension mechanism can work. There are two slide buttons to lower the ladder and then it comes down slowly section by section by itself. No problems with pinched fingers or hands. I would recommend it to any homeowner. I am in the upper end of the load limit and I felt very secure on the ladder. The best part is that I can store it almost anywhere, even in the back of a closet.
customer_reviews.author: Gift Card Recipient

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Neighbor Watching
customer_reviews.text: It was fun to explain to my wife that the box it arrived in contained a 12.5 foot ladder. This things is sturdy and the grips at bottom hold well and feel very secure. It is compact and easy to store. Making this 12 foot is a breeze, takes no time at all, smooth and secure. Absolutely love this. Easy to put away as well. Now, I can view my neighbors second story window perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the ladder the first 4 - 5 times I used it, however on the 6th time it failed and would not close all the way, which made it about 6 inchs to long for the allocated space I had in my 5th wheel storage compartment. I attempted to contact "Ohuhu" for guidance but to no avail as their site does not show ladders in their search menu. She now I am stuck with a ladder that is useless to me as I have no where to store it in my 5th wheel for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Cybersole55

customer_reviews.title: So light, compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: Can take it with me anywhere in a sedan Very light and compact. Easy to use. I always extend and retract these horizontally instead of vertically. Takes a little longer but feels safer. It does wobble a little bit and I weight about 180, but i think it's just the aluminum material. I don't think it will collapse as the metal has to fail. I'm more afraid of going on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Dionisio L Yang

customer_reviews.title: Bottom two steps just broke off.
customer_reviews.text: A few months in, a tab broke off so you have to use a screwdriver to lower that section and then just this weekend, the bottom two steps just broke off. Like completely off. Thankfully it wasn't a step higher up or someone really could have gotten hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Taka Iguchi

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in May 2020 My husband used this ladder to clean the gutters on our house with success. Ours had an issue in September 2020, but the company has excellent customer service and resolved our concerns. If you're on the fence, but need a ladder, I'd recommend this one. The aluminum is so light I can pick it up no issues. I struggle to move other ladders. It takes up a lot less space and I can even take it with me in my sedan.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great option to a regular extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: Just set it up and tried it for the first time. Does exactly what it's designed to do. Easy to move around, easy to set up and collapse. Sturdy enough for me to use when I'm at my winter weight. and it doesn't take up much room to store. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it needs one improvement. I would assume that if they can create a telescoping ladder like this, they could design it so that you could raise one leg at a time so that it could be used in a stairwell. Other than that it's great. Sure beats trying to move around a huge extension ladder. I would recommend this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Strong and convenient
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of telescoping ladders out there but I needed one that could hold close to 300 pounds and easy to open and close. This one does the job and I got a great price. After I had the ladder for awhile a friend asked if I could get him one like it. I found a "great deal" somewhere else and it looked the same in the picture but it was not nearly as well made, sturdy and each step had to be closed individually unlike this ladder. I found out then how much I really liked this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: vbbon

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good price. I haven't fallen yet from it so that says something...even though it's a bit nerve-racking going up and feeling the thing bounce a bit. Light weight (considering the alternative ladders at this height), easy to use. Just make sure the button click in place on either side of each step when telescoping them up. And...watch your fingers when you collapse the steps.
customer_reviews.author: MyMaster

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Light, portable, functional. Great for any job under ~15' (including your own height/reach) that doesn't require you to carry a lot up the ladder. (There's really no place to hang tools, paint, etc up top.). A little narrow up top, but not really a problem. Been using since purchase to work on security lighting. I weigh ~180 and it feels as sturdy as any other ladder I have, step, straight or extension. Extension/lock/retraction worked perfectly right out of the box. How long will it last? Not a terribly complex design...should be fine...
customer_reviews.author: L. Bovino

customer_reviews.title: Look at weight limits and how the locking system works.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder does not extend the right way. To get the ladder rings to lock in place, you have to start at the bottom of the ladder and go up. This makes no sense, if your in a tight space you will not be able to extend the ladder fully. The rings should lock in from the top down or just lock in place when extending. The way the ladder is set up, if I’m in a tight space I would have to extend the ladder fully then try to fit it in. If the ladder rings locked from top down I can just put it in the small space and extend it to what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Anthonypepe74

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertise
customer_reviews.text: I love it; light and convenient - and especially for homeowner who will use it maybe 2-3 times a year does what it should. Folds so it's easier to store it and don't have to worry about walking with something that's 8 feet long thru the garage/around the house. If I'm a contractor and had to carry heavy load up and down everyday - might not be the best option, but for homeowner that needs it once every blue moon - perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Opyd

customer_reviews.title: No longer a finger pincher!
customer_reviews.text: When these ladders first​ came out, they would inevitably pinch the hell out of your hand/fingers. They seem to have solved this issue. When you release the steps, each section glides down smoothly and without the fear of hurting yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Joe Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: I weigh around 300 lb and I used it set ...
customer_reviews.text: I weigh around 300 lb and I used it set about 9 ft. high doing some work under the roof eaves of my house and had no problems. A suggestion I have is that you get a strap to bind the lower steps after extending to a non full extension position for if you go to move it then the lower not extended steps will try to drop down and will hinder you moving the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: cscott.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I used this to get into the attic to check on isolation. I would have had a devil of a time getting a ladder into the house, but using the Telescoping Ladder proved to be easy as pie! Later I needed to get on the roof to cut some overhanging branches, again worked like a charm. I haven't noticed any flexing or sway and the footing feels nice and steady. I store this ladder in the space between the fridge and wall, out of the way, but easy to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Eris Reddoch

customer_reviews.title: Stable, a tad bulky and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: A great ladder for my needs, though a bit heavier than necessary (for MY needs). It extends and retracts easily, with a very stable stance and easy maneuverability when extended. Take careful note of the weght and collapsed measurements for storage and carrying purposes as this ladder may be the Baby Huey of its class. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bosshart19

customer_reviews.title: This is INCREDIBLY easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is INCREDIBLY easy to use, so lightweight, easy to get in and out. I use this ladder as an access to the roof of my camper in lieu of a mounted ladder and since purchase, many people who I've demonstrated its use for have purchased on as well. I love that I can start raising it up and drape a blanket or towel to the top rung for protection of the van. Truly very happy with this ladder!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Always lean properly, check before ascending, and secure when needed.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to reach the solar on my van. Just secure it to rack at top and up I go. Stores great inside van. Light weight and sturdy. Like the plastic between the runs so when resting against van don’t have to use anything to protect painted surface.
customer_reviews.author: Bessy true

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good ladder, especially for RVers
customer_reviews.text: A must with a camper...i use it to inspect and cut down low hanging branches at campsites and to blow the slide off. I'm 260, holds me just fine. Top rungs "look" like they move a bit side to side but it held me fine, wasnt worried once up there. Stores away nicely when space is a premium.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to raise and lower.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5 star but for the fact that the sliding lever on the 2nd rung that allows the ladder to fully retract to its designated position is a little hard to manage. But realistically, if that's all the issue, I will not hesitate to reorder their product or to recommend it. The release levers are strategically located under each rung so as to prevent accidentally collapse of the ladder rungs. Used it on full extension without any concerns. Very sturdy. On the service side I encountered an issue that was promptly addressed and remedied. Kudos for their attention to customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Hummerjock@RV

customer_reviews.title: Completely broke after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Around month 3, I started having issues with it closing. Some rungs kept getting stuck and wouldn't close. It was a very regular problem I was having. Now, 2 months later, I went to open the ladder up and it just separated at the 3rd step. Literally the ladder came apart at the 3rd step and I had two separate pieces. Unrepairable, and I'm pretty handy. Not happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: real handy - one broke, replaced free
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these ladders to use to get on a boat while on land. Worked fine. Not heavy and it is quite compact when folded. I think someone at the marina moved the ladder when I wasn't there and broke it somehow since it was in a different place. After that it didn't retract or extend right. It was less than 90 days so got a replacement for free. Beats using 12ft ladder or heavy and bulky traditional extension ladder. Works for me. Only a 4 rating since 1st one broke though I don't know if the marina abused it when moving it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Ohuhu 12.5 FT Aluminum Telescopic Extension Ladder, ONE-Button RETRACTION New Design Telescoping Ladder, ANSI Certified Extendable Ladder with Spring Loaded Locking Mechanism, 330 Pound Capacity
feature_bullets: ✅ One Button Retraction: Convenience is key! That’s why we’ve designed this ladder with easy one button retraction. Simply press down on the thumb buttons and the ladder will slide down effortlessly.
✅ Premium Aluminum Alloy: The Ohuhu Telescopic Extension Ladder is crafted from high-quality aluminum alloy. It’s lightweight and easy to carry without sacrificing strength.

✅ Rock-Solid Stability: This ladder is as sturdy as they come, with a weight capacity of up to 330lbs! Non-slip end caps hold the base firmly in place, while extra-wide steps ensure safe climbing. We’ve also made sure that this ladder is compliant with EN131 and SGS European safety standards to give you some peace of mind.

✅ Safe to Use: No more pinched fingers! The telescoping ladder’s high quality construction ensures that each section expands and retracts safely. Intelligent locking pins hold the sections in place and prevent sliding, and the ladder will retract smoothly and slowly.

✅ Extreme Versatility: This telescopic ladder is the homeowner’s best friend. Thanks to its maximum height of 12.5 ft (3.8m) , the Ohuhu Telescope Extension Ladder is perfect for all of your specific needs. Use it to help paint the walls, change the light bulbs, clean the windows, and everything in between.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,462 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
